meanings.sent1: The color of the walls is irrelevant to the discussion.
meanings.sent2: Her favorite movie is irrelevant to the task at hand.
meanings.sent3: The topic of ice cream flavors is irrelevant during a math class.
meanings.sent4: In a sea of black umbrellas, her bright yellow one stood out like an irrelevant detail.
meanings.sent5: The smell of fresh cookies in the kitchen made the burnt toast seem even more irrelevant.

meanings.sent1: His opinion on the matter is irrelevant to the decision-making process.
meanings.sent2: The typo in the email was irrelevant to the overall message.
meanings.sent3: Arguing about who gets the last cookie is irrelevant when there's a cake on the table.
meanings.sent4: The single raindrop in the storm seemed as irrelevant as a whisper in a hurricane.
meanings.sent5: The buzzing of a fly became irrelevant background noise in the midst of a thunderous applause.
